Appearance: Yes Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 8/7/2014 Minutes: JUMPER, Benjamin Jerimiah, M.D. appeared before the Board in response to an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing. Upon a motion by Dr. B. Cogburn, seconded by Dr. S. Simon, the Board voted unanimously there has been a violation of the Arkansas Medical Practices Act, that is, ACA 17-95-409 (a)( 2 )(e) and (h). The Board further voted to continue the hearing until the October 2014 meeting and that during the interim, Dr. Jumper s medical license remains suspended. Appearance: Yes Reason: Board Related Date of Action: 10/2/2014 Minutes: JUMPER, Benjamin Jerimiah, M.D. appeared before the Board in response to an Emergency Order of Suspension and Notice of Hearing. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Dr. J. Hearnsberger, the Board voted unanimously that there has been a violation of the Arkansas Medical Practices Act, that is, ACA 17-95-409 (a)( 2 )(e) and (h). As a result of the violations, Dr. Jumper s license is revoked for five years, with said revocation being stayed so long as he complies with the following conditions: Dr. Jumper must remain compliant with his monitoring contract with the Arkansas Medical Foundation; obtain prior approval for work site and type of work; request the Board s permission prior to reapplying for a DEA permit; pay investigative and hearing costs of $609.50 and a fine of $1,000.00 within one year; and return to the December 2014 meeting for an update. The suspension of his license was lifted. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 12/5/2014 Minutes: JUMPER, Benjamin Jerimiah, M.D. appeared for his Arkansas Medical Foundation update. Upon a motion by Dr. S. Simon, seconded by Mr. S. Pace, the Board voted unanimously to accept his appearance for information only and requested he return to the April 2015 meeting for his next update. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 4/9/2015 Minutes: JUMPER, Benjamin Jerimiah, M.D. appeared for his Arkansas Medical Foundation update. Upon a motion by Dr. O. Atiq, seconded by Dr. V. Hodges, the Board voted unanimously to allow Dr. Jumper to work in the free clinic and requested he return to the October 2015 meeting for his next update. Appearance: Yes Reason: Update Date of Action: 10/1/2015 Minutes: JUMPER, Benjamin Jerimiah, M.D. appeared for his Arkansas Medical Foundation update. Upon a motion by Dr. J. The Board voted that the physician return for an update at the December 2015 meeting.
